name: Deborah Butterfield
image: 'Nahele', metal sculpture by --Deborah Butterfield--, 1986, --The Contemporary Museum, Honolulu--.jpg
caption: Honolulu Museum of Art Spalding House
alt: Honolulu Museum of Art Spalding House
summary: Deborah Kay Butterfield (born May 7, 1949) is an American sculptor. Along with her artist-husband John Buck, she divides her time between a farm in Bozeman, Montana and studio space in Hawaii. She is known for her sculptures of horses made from found objects, like metal, and especially pieces of wood.
